title: How to Make Fruit Cake Truffles

steps.headline: Chop the dark chocolate into small pieces.
steps.description: It will be melted, so the smaller the pieces, the better, but don't be fussy about the shape or size.

steps.headline: Crumble the fruit cake.
steps.description: Using your fingers, break up the fruit cake slices or chunks into a mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Add the chopped chocolate, butter/oil and cream to the heatproof bowl.
steps.description: Place the bowl in a pan of simmering water. Allow the ingredients to melt together.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate mixture over the crumbled fruit cake in the bowl.
steps.description: Add the rum or rum extract. Stir it all together.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to set.
steps.description: Cover to keep odors out. The mixture is ready to turn into truffles when it feels firm to touch.

steps.headline: Remove the truffle mixture from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Dig out a heaped teaspoon of the mixture to form the first truffle.

steps.headline: Roll the mixture into a neat ball.
steps.description: Roll in the coating of choice. Sprinkle the coating across a saucer before rolling the balls.

steps.headline: Repeat with the remaining truffle mix until all of it has been turned into truffles.
Serve or prepare as a gift.
steps.description: For serving: Line a plate or tray with foil and arrange as wished. Keep refrigerated until serving time, to firm them completely. For gift: Line a box or container with wax paper, baking paper or foil. Arrange the truffles in one layer. If adding another layer, place another layer of paper/foil to prevent sticking. Stop after two layers or the top truffles will squash the ones beneath. Keep refrigerated until it's time to give them.

text: Preparing the ingredients Chop the dark chocolate into small pieces. It will be melted, so the smaller the pieces, the better, but don't be fussy about the shape or size. Crumble the fruit cake. Using your fingers, break up the fruit cake slices or chunks into a mixing bowl. Making the truffle mixture Add the chopped chocolate, butter/oil and cream to the heatproof bowl. Place the bowl in a pan of simmering water. Allow the ingredients to melt together. Remove from the heat.  Pour the melted chocolate mixture over the crumbled fruit cake in the bowl. Add the rum or rum extract. Stir it all together. Place in the refrigerator to set. Cover to keep odors out. The mixture is ready to turn into truffles when it feels firm to touch. Making the fruit cake truffles Remove the truffle mixture from the refrigerator. Dig out a heaped teaspoon of the mixture to form the first truffle. Roll the mixture into a neat ball. Roll in the coating of choice. Sprinkle the coating across a saucer before rolling the balls. Repeat with the remaining truffle mix until all of it has been turned into truffles.  Serve or prepare as a gift. For serving: Line a plate or tray with foil and arrange as wished. Keep refrigerated until serving time, to firm them completely. For gift: Line a box or container with wax paper, baking paper or foil. Arrange the truffles in one layer. If adding another layer, place another layer of paper/foil to prevent sticking. Stop after two layers or the top truffles will squash the ones beneath. Keep refrigerated until it's time to give them. Finished.
